intro: Englerastrum adenophorum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf morning glory, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. It has a creeping stem that can produce numerous flowering shoots, and its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its invasive potential in some areas.
